title: New states imported even though my node was fully synced
body:
#### System information

Geth version: v1.9.0-unstable-a89170cf
OS & Version: Ubuntu server 18.04.1
Commit hash : a89170cf

I am opening a new issue as requested. My application started returning eth_blockNumber 0x0 so I checked what was happening with my node, in the log I see that it started --all of the sudden-- importing a load of new states even though it was fully synced!

```

I restarted the node and now it is taking a long time upgrading the chain index, note not sure if this is realted but https://ropsten.etherscan.io has been also reindexing for days now.

not sure I understand what is happening!

```

I'd say it wasn''t synced. What makes you say it was synced? What does it say in the first couple (20 or so) lines when you start it up ?

Yeah, you're most likely only done with the block download phase, and still, need to run the state downloads.  This issue goes over it fairly well.
https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/issues/16251
yes, I resynced because I restarted it in between and it was taking forever to sync (fast doesn't work).
same issue, node was synced and running fine and as soon as I upgraded to v1.8.23 all the states were lost and are now being downloaded very slowly. Went back to v1.8.22, same issue.
